dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of hands rifles through the pages of a book. Disca it and grabs another. The process repeats until a folded ARTICLE is revealed, nestled within a hardback. A slender yet handsome figure -- we don’t get a good look his face, but we’ll learn this is ALEX LINDEN (27) -- unf and scans the pages. He stuffs them in his suit jacket, g his cell phone and walks downstairs towards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex gets in the tub, raising the steaming water to the b Grabs his phone and scans Twitter (@AlexLinden). New mess cascade down the screen. He types: Ask for me tomorrow, a you shall find me a grave man. Clicks “Tweet.” His messag joins a rushing tide and tumbles down the page, out of si He drops his phone in the bath, revealing his stricken fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An office building around midtown. A lonely figure is illuminated at his desk by the glare of florescent light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phones ring. Shouts reverberate across the open room. Mid aged men with stained shirts and considerable guts bluste down aisles of desks holding mock-ups of tomorrow's paper BEN KAPLAN (27) -- tall and reedy, and more contemplative than most -- takes a big gulp of coffee and hunches over computer. We GLIMPSE what looks like a fledgeling novel: words “Chapter Two” and a whole lot of white space.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT EDITOR, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ben. Your pages set? Ben CLICKS AWAY quickly to a newspaper layout. The NIGHT EDITOR slows as he nears but doesn’t stop.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Almost. Ben turns to his computer. SCROLLS to reveal A PHOTO of in a penis costume getting arrested. An empty headline fi waiting to be filled. Ben’s cell phone RINGS, breaking his concentration.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Alex. But Ben doesn’t recognize the number. Decides to answer i

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Yeah I’m at work so-- (a beat) Please tell me this is a sick joke. Ben looks like he’s been hit by a ton of bricks. He CHECK HIS MISSED CALLS: It’s “Alex Linden” all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRI HOPKINS (26) -- beautiful, arty, ethereal -- turns a opened envelope over and over in her hands. Reopens it: “Dear Ms. Siri Hopkins: Congratulations! You have been na a J. Liddle Urban Architectural Fellow for 2013...” Siri refolds the letter. Feels a heady mix of elation and dread. She hears KEYS JANGLING IN THE HALLWAY and loses h nerve. Flicks off the bedside light and lies back in bed. The DOOR OPENS and Ben appears, silhouetted by the hallwa fluorescents. He sheds his clothes while Siri feigns slee Slips into bed and holds her from behind. Siri stirs.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Good day? Ben buries his face in the nape of Siri’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Siri. It’s... Siri opens her eyes and turns to fix Ben with her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Hey. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students walk briskly across dewy quads. PRE-LAP: A PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSH LIPSCHITZ (27) -- a spectacled, ill-shaven mess -- i startled from sleep. His desk is covered in booze, books, cigarettes. He knocks them over while groping for his pho

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I had a freshman roommate named Ben, but that ass wad hasn’t called in ages. (takes in the bad news) Oh fuck. Fuck me! Well I’m not going. (listens) Because I’m not, okay? Josh hangs up and blinks his eyes silently for a moment. Suddenly possessed, he gathers up his belongings. On his out, he slams a Post-it over the NAME PLATE on his door: Office Hours Cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH GALLO (26) -- pantsuit, plain, yet wholesomely pret ducks her head down near her desk, talking quietly into h cell phone. The firm buzzes with activity around her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Are you serious? Of course you are. What a stupid question. I'll... train up as soon as I can, okay? Sarah struggles to keep her emotions in check.  10 A mountain of papers lands WITH A THUD on her desk. She e her call and looks up to see a SENIOR ASSOCIATE, smiling cynically. Sarah smiles back, wiping away a stray tear. S picks up the office phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAAC SMITH (27) -- warm eyes, bespoke suit -- walks bris by a PERSONAL SECRETARY into his office, talking on a headset. The San Francisco Bay gleams outside his window.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Sarah. Sarah! Calm down. Take a breath. At least he’s alive, right? He hears THE BEEP OF CALL WAITING. Sees a picture of KATE MURPHY (22) -- California pretty and young -- on his phon

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shoot. Hold on one second, okay? (clicking over) Hey baby. Yeah, I’m fine. I think I’m just gonna book myself a flight and leave the office now. Isaac keeps one eye on the Dow and another on a travel website. His face tells us he’s said the wrong thing.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course I want you there with me. I just don’t want this to have to be a big thing for you... Okay, okay! Here. I’11 book us both right now. Sound good? Talk soon. (clicking back) Sarah, you there? I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SIRI’S CAR, UPSTATE NEW YORK - EARLY AFTERNOON 10 Siri drives her old Saab while Ben navigates via iphone.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Here. This one. Siri doesn’t have enough time to react. They both watch a their intended exit zips by. Siri sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say now?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s “recalculating”...

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Then what am I supposed to--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Siri turns right.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Do you know when he’1l be able to be released?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I think tonight. Maybe tomorrow morning. Keep going straight. Siri absorbs Ben’s anxiety. Calculates whether this is th best time to spill her secret. It’s not. But fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I got the fellowship. Ben’s floored.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: When were you planning on telling me?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m doing it now.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: But how long have you known?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I found out yesterday but it didn’t really... seem like the right time. (a beat) So...  15

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m really happy for you. It’s a great opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I know. I meant about us. Moving out there. Do I turn up here?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No. Go straight... Siri you know I... I can’t just quit my job and move to LA.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Because newspapers aren’t hiring. They're laying people off.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: You don’t even like your job.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well I like not-liking it.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you're doing this while we’re on our way up to--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hold on. Can we just... table this?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Table our relationship?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No. I mean. Press pause. Just focus on Alex. Don’t let everyone in on our own... stuff. Siri looks at Ben. This is the opposite of how she hoped talk might go but she’s just as happy to drop it.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Of course. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Siri pull up to a rundown house tucked in the woo and get out of the car. Ben tries breaking the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when we first came here? Place looks worse than it did. Siri chooses silence in lieu of a reply. Ben finds a key hidden under a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Siri wander, taking in the mess: bowls everywhere cigarette butts, the place dusty and suffocating. They pi up dishware and open windows, moving in silence.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: (checking her watch) Sarah's train should be getting in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’'1l wait here for the others. Siri turns to go. Ben catches her wrist. Kisses her cheek resumes cleaning as she departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commuters bustle down the outdoor platform. Josh, eyes on paperback, nearly runs into Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Josh! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sarah! They hug awkwardly. Sarah’s a bit flustered by his presen

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I... It’s good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Uh. You too.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Have you talked to Alex? Josh walks. Sarah follows him with her rolling suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I can’t wait to ask the fucker what the hell he was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (horrified) You're not actually going to do that, right?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Because he’s obviously... fragile!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: How do you know? When was the last time you talked to him? (OFF Sarah’s look) Okay what do you propose? We all just tiptoe around?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How about we make him feel safe. And loved. And--

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: In other words pretend like nothing’s wrong. That’s bullshit and he’1l smell it. Sarah’s about to respond when...

dialogues.speaker: SIRI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Sarah! Josh! They find Siri. She and Sarah hug like the old friends th are. Siri looks at Josh. SIRI (CONT’D) We weren’t sure whether to expect you. Josh nods. Keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: That jerk-off boyfriend of yours still mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I think he thinks you’re mad at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ how self-absorbed can one man be?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. You're still ina category of your own. Josh absorbs Sarah’s dart. Follows her towards Siri’s car

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (sticking it right back) When are Isaac and his lady friend getting in?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wait. Isaac is bringing a date?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: His girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I didn’t know he was seeing anyone.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: It’s recent.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (rubbing it in) She's 22.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No she’s not.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What? It’s not like she’s 12.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: One. You’re disgusting. Two. Why does he think it’s at all appropriate to bring her?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why not? Young people are incredibly comfortable with voyeurism. Let’s just hope we can compete with Bravo. Josh gets in the car. OFF Sarah, still outside, stewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac hands his CREDIT CARD to an EMPLOYEE, who walks awa process his rental agreement. Kate stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Have you heard how he’s doing?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I don’t know. How do people normally do after things like this?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It depends. Most of the time they say they regret it. But there’s also a high rate of repeats. Isaac processes this information. They wait together in a moment of awkward silence. KATE (CONT’D) It’s okay that I’m coming, right?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to come and I said it’s fine. So, it’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No no no. I said I wanted to be there for you if you wanted me to be there. Should I not be here?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Of course you should be here. Everyone’s excited to meet you. The rental car employee returns with a CONTRACT and a SET

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, but all our premium class vehicles are unavailable. Could we interest you in one of our other options?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Whatever has wheels.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I shouldn’t have come. Isaac sighs. Kate’s a bundle of nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a + HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben approaches the bathroom door. He’s armed with a spong and bleach and dreading what kind of scene Alex may have behind. He steels himself. Opens the door to reveal... A QUICK YET DISTURBING GLIMPSE of dried blood in the bath clinging to the grout between the tiles. A bloody handpri Ben SLAMS the door shut. Before he can decide what to do hears Siri’s car PULL UP outside. Car doors OPEN AND SLAM

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, it’s an objective truth: The Japanese are the most whacked-out people on earth. Josh and Sarah tumble in the dining room. Siri’s behind t with a BAG OF GROCERIES. Ben collects himself before join

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're like an eight-year-old racist.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Come on. Cram that many people on an island and it’s like a throbbing, inbred hothouse of cultural miasma. Frankly, I’m surprised they don’t have more fetishes. (noticing Ben) Ben Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You came.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah against my better fucking judgement. Josh keeps his distance. There’s a split second of tensio

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Get the fuck over here. 19A Ben wraps Josh in a bear hug. Josh wrestles away.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Back me up here, Ben. We’re not really going to just pretend with Alex like nothing happened, right? All the levity of their greeting quickly vanishes.  12.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What are you supposed to say? “Hey Alex. Interesting choice to commit suicide.”

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ben. Hi, by the way. Sarah and Ben hug.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you're on her side.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Hey. There are no sides. This is about Alex, remember? Everyone's momentarily chastened by Siri’s comment. Then start going at it again.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think we should watch him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What? Like... set up a monitoring system?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It'd be casual. But yeah, tag in and out. Have someone with him at all times.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: We're his friends, not the Gestapo. This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, it’s not. I googled it.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Case in point. This conversation is making Ben more and more uncomfortab

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I need to get some air. Ben walks outside. OFF the perplexed looks of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks outside. Lights a cigarette to calm his nerves. runs smack into... Alex, stepping out of a taxi. Alex's face lights up when realizes who it is. Ben, for his part, looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You came!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Course I did. Alex and Ben embrace. Alex starts back towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m good! (a beat) Well, you know. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Alex. Look-- Ben halts things. Josh and Sarah’s LOUD VOICES from withi disrupt the moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me we’re having a party in honor of my suicide.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jesus: attempt. If it were a suicide we’d both be wearing suits. Alex smiles. His whole demeanor is too upbeat and exagger to be believed. He opens the front door to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh and Sarah, mid-argument.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The first 48 hours are incredibly important. So if you can stop being such a-- (she notices Alex) Alex!  14. Sarah drops everything and rushes for him, holding him ti After a moment, Alex extracts himself.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey. It’s okay. Sarah wipes away a tear and nods. Alex looks to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You know, you could’ve just sent an email if you wanted us to visit.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Josh! But Alex smiles. Hugs Josh. Then has a moment with Siri.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: We were going to pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. This was easier.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Do you want to sit down? Can we get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You sure? It’s awkward. Alex is projecting equanimity but underneat just wants to get away from everyone’s cloying concern.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Actually, I’m gonna go upstairs and get changed. Feel a little gross, if you know what I mean. Sarah shoots Ben a look. Ben realizes it’s his cue.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Here. Lemme come with. Alex shrugs, nonchalant. Ben follows him upstairs. The ot stare at each other, perplexed, until he’s out of earshot

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Well he seems fine to me. Guess our work here is done.  22 15.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Clearly he’s in shock.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Way to act normal, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Way to be an asshole. OFF Siri, upset and irritated with both of them.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALEX’S ROOM, THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 22 Alex rummages for a fresh change of clothes while Ben tak in his Spartan accommodations: a bed, a desk, and a stack books by Wilde, Joyce, Eliot, and Pound.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jesus, Alex. Is this your only blanket?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s warmer than it looks. Ben picks up a book and uncovers some LONGHAND SCRIBBLING

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Why’d you leave LA?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Acting thing was only going okay. That city’s a fucking soul killer. And I just felt... Alex removes his shirt. There are bandages on his wrists an intensity in his look that wasn’t there a minute ago.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, shit. I was running out of cash. My mom’s in fucking Bali. My dad had left me this. You and I'd kind of lost touch and--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Alex... about the calls... if I'd known-- Alex cuts him off.  23 16.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey. World’s got enough people you gotta explain yourself to. Alex throws on a fresh shirt and his demeanor is once mor disconcertingly jovial. He walks into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember junior year when you had that meeting with a publisher?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You were so late you had to run across campus, all drenched in sweat. I gave you my shirt so you’d look halfway presentable.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You walked home half-naked.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s just like old times, isn’t it? It’s crazy. OFF Ben, alone. Nodding but thinking it’s anything but.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘SARAH'S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 23 Siri helps Sarah settle into a dusty room. Together they sheets on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: If Josh is going to be like this all weekend...

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: He’s just dealing with it. In his own way.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And shouldn’t Isaac know there’s no such thing as a “plus one” to a friend’s failed suicide attempt? It’s not a fucking bar mitzvah.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Now you sound like Josh.  24 17.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: God, you're right. How are you and Ben?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Good fine? Okay fine?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So not-so-good fine. Siri sighs. They both sit down on the half-made bed. SARAH (CONT’D) What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m... late.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Like how late?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Late late.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Does Ben know?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: We're just... doing that thing where we snipe at each other. Silly stuff. It’1ll pass. The two girls look at each other. Sarah can tell that the more going on. Siri playfully whacks Sarah with a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits down next to Alex.  18.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey. You need anything? Food? Water?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Still fine... Josh searches around for the bathroom but Ben cuts him of

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Where’s the bathroom again?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Use the one in the upstairs hallway. Josh gives Ben a strange look. Sarah’s phone RINGS. Ben s down next to Sarah and Alex.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey Isaac, what’s up? (a pause) What’s the matter? Can your child bride not read a map? (another pause) Okay, okay!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That was a low blow. Sarah hangs up. Ignores Ben.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Isaac says he’s close but he’s lost.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: (entering) I'll drive and meet them.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (getting up) I‘1l get some firewood. Josh?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Fuck it I’ll pee in nature. The two join Siri in getting ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’1l stay and watch Alex. Whoops. That just came out. Alex shoots her a look.  25 19.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (frustrated, embarrassed) I mean, I'll... put on some pasta. It’s awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben places a log on a stump and wields a hand axe unstead

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You clearly have no idea what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Ben strikes the log, succeeding only in getting the axe stuck. Josh takes it from him and pries it loose.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Here. Josh splits a sliver off cleanly with a ferocious blow.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Lemme try again.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Uh uh?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I taught you all of Calc 21 and then you did better than me on the final. I’m not teaching you how to chop wood.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I can’t help it if you have performance anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hey. I can perform just fine.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Just let me try again.  26 20.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on. Ben reaches for the axe but Josh won’t give it up.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I said, I got it. Josh raises the axe and delivers another blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah channels her anxiety into chopping garlic at the ta while Alex unobtrusively plays sous-chef.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You don’t have to cook, you know.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s okay. It’s the one thing that relaxes me, actually. Alex hops onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Really? Cause you don’t seem that relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s just been a while, you know? Since I’ve seen everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You mean Josh? Or Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sarah crosses over to the counter, next to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If you need to get something off your chest, you should.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What is this? You try to off yourself and now you’re Oprah?  21. Sarah’s suddenly embarrassed. Turns back to her vegetable

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. God. I’m sorry. It’s just... sometimes it’s more complicated than that, you know?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. They hear A CAR IDLING UP the driveway. Sarah crosses to window and they both spy on Isaac and Kate unpacking the

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (fuck) She's hot.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Your boobs are bigger.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siri, Isaac, and Kate all burst in, bearing luggage. Alex walks over to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to fly across the country.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Hey. I wanted to. This is Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey I’ve heard a lot about you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’ve heard a lot about you. It’s awkward. Kate wants to find a hole and hide. Josh en and CLOCKS Isaac’s leather shoes.  22.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What the fuck are those?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Is that how you say hi now?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: They're shiny and pointy.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: They’re Italian. So what? Ben has entered.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Isaac. If you’d told us you’d become a homosexual we could’ve thrown you a party.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (to Kate) I’m sorry. I was hoping to keep up the charade that my friends were normal for at least a few seconds. Josh grins.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Is there a bathroom I could use?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH AND BEN
dialogues.text: Upstairs! Isaac gives them a strange look. Sarah enters. Hesitates second when she sees Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Dinner’s ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole group sits around a table eating Sarah’s pasta.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sarah, this is delicious.  23.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s pasta and sauce from a can. Tomorrow I'll make something real.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Instagram tells me you're still cooking a lot.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ugh. Instagram lies. Unless Ramen counts.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: So being a lawyer's fulfilling all your hopes and dreams.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Not all of us can stand astride the planet on the backs of hedge funds.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Josh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, we graduated at the onset of the worst recession in eighty years. History says most of us will never regain the income levels we might have otherwise enjoyed. Isaac here is a beautiful anomaly and for that we salute him.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Thanks Josh. How’s the PhD?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: It’s a simple question.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: But it had subtext.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You want the subtext?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Of course I want the subtext.  29

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: How’s life on your academic pedestal, reading books and despairing about the decline of our culture?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It’s comments like those that make me despair.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Seriously. What do you do all day?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I'm writing about the future of biography. How our ever-expanding digital footprint -- emails, texts, tweets, what have you -- will inform our “understanding of history and ourselves.”

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Which is ironic.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Because I hate the modern world.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What era would you rather have lived in?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Honey. The only thing I hate more than the present is nostalgia for the past. The former roommates trade uncomfortable looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben does dishes. Isaac dries. Alex and Josh lounge.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Ben) You don’t have to do them all. 24. There’s a charged moment that could go either way. Isaac laughs it off.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It’s okay. He’s compensating for the fact that he can’t chop wood.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Since when did you become a bitter old man?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Around the same time you traded in for those shoes.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You know, this whole footwear smear campaign is cutting me deep.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe you should commit suicide. (OFF the others’ looks) What? Too soon?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 30 INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 3 Siri and Sarah help Kate settle into a room upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: So how’d you meet Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It's... embarrassing. I was an intern. At his office. Sarah shoots Siri a look of disgust. Kate doesn’t catch i

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we didn’t start dating until after I left, of course.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Of course you didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays. Everyone drinks. Sarah photo-abuses the othe with her iphone. Isaac busies himself on his Blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So how’s the novel, Ben?  26.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Good. Close to done.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Are we in it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yes and no.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is tonight in it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Not yet...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Tonight seems like it should definitely be in it.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Is it better or worse than your New Yorker story?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s without a doubt longer.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (snapping a photo) God I loved that story.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s the reason Siri agreed to go on a date with me.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: No, it’s not. But it didn’t hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I think I still have a copy here.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You know what? We should stage a dramatic reading.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why not? You can play the protagonist. I’1l be the roommate.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Really, Josh. It’s fine.  27. That came out harsher than Ben intended. He and Josh are worked up by talk of Ben’s story. Sarah takes another pho

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Jesus can you stop with the photos?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m recording the moment for posterity.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: By ruining it in the present?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (snapping another one) You're an ass.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Come on. Both you guys--

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? Put ‘em on facebook?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You're clinically obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I like seeing what my friends are up to. So what?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: So your News Feed tells you Isaac is enjoying a Merlot in Napa, or Ben wrote a funny headline for the Post, and you think that means you still know someone?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Josh. Sarah--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do. Because that’s what people do, Josh. People who care, at least.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sorry but I’d rather be in the fucking dark about what people are up to than mistake some false level of intimacy for friendship.  28. Josh's words hang uncomfortably in the air.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We're still friends.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Isaac’s on his Blackberry sending work emails to San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (stashing his phone) Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Remember that time freshman year when we all got high and went to check out the glass flowers at the Natural History Museum?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You got so paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You had to talk me down. Kate notes their intimacy. Places her arm around Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What was Isaac like in college?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dorky.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Uncultured.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Pretty much exactly as he is now. Kate kisses Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Then he must have been adorable.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What do you do, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I work at a suicide and crisis hotline for teens in the Bay Area. (a beat) Sorry. I didn’t realize how strange that would sound until it came out.  29.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Shame I didn’t have your number. Could’ve solved all my problems. Kate looks at the ground and blushes. No one knows whethe rebuke Alex for his meanness. Siri stands up.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m going to bed. She gives Ben a look that means he’s meant to follow her.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Me too, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Already? Hey it is just like college! Ben begs him, “not now,” with his eyes before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Think they’1l get married?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I want to go to a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You'd wish them eternal unhappiness in exchange for a cover band.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who says they’d be unhappy?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: The institution of marriage is inherently unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If anyone can do it, they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ‘BEN AND SIRI’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 32 Ben and Siri undress and lie down on opposite sides of th bed. A small universe separates them.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Why did you lie?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What? When?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: To Alex. About the book.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t. I’m working on it. (OFF Siri’s stare) Because this weekend’s not about my problems, okay? But we can schedule one of those if you like.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: These are your best friends, Ben. They’1l always be impressed by you.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Then they’re fucking idiots. (a long pause) He’d been calling me. A lot recently.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Alex. Always just checking in. Nothing much to say. Asking about the book, the book. It got to the point where I was screening his calls. When the hospital called I thought it was him again. And I... Ben chokes up. Can’t finish his sentence.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Hey. It’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: But it kind of is, right? Ben look away from Siri. The gulf between them remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate’s fallen asleep next to Isaac on the couch. Sarah, A and Josh sit across from them, overtired and slaphappy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Kate seems really sweet.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: If you make one more comment...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? I’m being serious! She looks as peaceful as a child. Alex, Sarah and Josh try to stifle their laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: That’s it. Bedtime. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Lemme come up with you? Alex shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Sarah brush their teeth, jockeying for space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac carries a half-asleep Kate to their room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh sits alone, rolling a joint. Lights it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 37 32. INT. ALEX’S ROOM, THE CABIN - NIGHT 37 Alex lies down and Sarah follows suit, her head in his la

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s funny. All of us breathing under the same roof again. Do you ever wish we could just go back?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sometimes. Actually, not really.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I guess I was mainly just scared.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Of you all. Of the possibility that you didn’t like me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s the truth. I remember, that feeling, it didn’t go away until junior year. Ben had me at his parents’ place in New York for Easter. I don’t know what it was. It just felt like I'd entered this warm space, you know? We took the train there and back. Barely talked. It was better than talking. Sarah’s emotions swell. She sits up to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Alex, I don’t know how to say this but have you thought about therapy? ‘Cause I’ve done it a lot and--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You have? Why?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know. Just stuff about how I’m constantly anxious but can never pinpoint why. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ever since college I feel like I can only be with guys who are assholes or married. Or both.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Has it helped?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well. I take Xanax now. That does wonders for the anxiety. My therapist says the other stuff is very deep-rooted. (a beat) Oh my god. Here I am talking... I’m so self-absorbed. This is why I need therapy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, it isn’t. We just need sleep.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I know but... can I get you something? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sarah. You’re going to have to stop asking me that.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 38 Isaac and Kate crowd together in a twin bed, spooning. Is is drifting off to sleep. Kate is wide awake.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Isaac... Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Yes. Kate pauses.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you like about me? (a quick beat) You waited too long.  39 34.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Come on. I was thinking!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well now I can’t trust what you say because it didn’t just come to you.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Are you being serious right now?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: They all think I’m young and stupid. Maybe I am.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You’re neither. Now please. Stop. OFF Kate, unable to slow her spinning mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah exits the bathroom and stumbles into Josh.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was just... Josh tries not to look at Sarah’s breasts.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I was... watching Real Housewives of Atlanta the other week and--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No you weren't.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I was! It was on, I was there, I couldn’t look away, and then I thought, “This show, it’s really about the human condition and--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Josh. Shut up.  40 41 42 35. A pregnant moment. Then THEY’RE GOING AT IT, making out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘BEN AND SIRI’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 40 Ben and Siri listen to A BED GROANING RHYTHMICALLY.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Sarah and Josh?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Like old times. Siri kisses Ben. He can’t get himself to engage. She brea it off and turns away, frustrated. Ben hates himself. He studies Siri’s beautiful back, but he can’t touch it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 41 THE GROANING NOISE is even faster and louder now.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I thought they hated each other.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: They do and they don’t. It’s a weird game they play.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Your friends are fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I think they prefer “complicated.”

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let’s never be like them.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Deal. Isaac kisses Kate. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘JOSH'S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 42 Josh and Sarah lie together in bed. Half-undressed and feeling slightly dirty. Sarah begins to gather her clothe  36.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know why I keep letting this happen.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe because you want it too.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. This is just something I think I want and later feel awful about.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Are Ben and Siri acting weird, or is it just me?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s just you.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Do you think they heard us?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How would I know?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: She always was a light sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You know just how she'd wear those dorky orange ear plugs and still complain about the church bells waking her up every morning and--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (getting it, appalled) You're still in love with her, aren’t you? Josh looks away.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why just because she’s gorgeous and smart and has the most symmetrical face known to man? And Ben gets everything he’s ever wanted in life and I get--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where do you get off thinking the whole universe is conspiring against you?  43 44 45 37.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Wanna go again?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You’re a dick.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: All guys are dicks. We’re hard- wired that way. It’s a simple matter of natural selection.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're a dick who imagines he’s better than one because he can back up his dickish behavior with psycho- babble and pseudo-science.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah you’re right. So you want to go again? Sarah shakes her head at his temerity. They go at it agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex picks up his rumpled jacket. Digs into the pockets a finds Ben’s waterlogged article. As he separates the crac pages and lays them on his desk he reads the author bio: “Ben Kaplan is pursuing his BA at Yale University. At 21, is the youngest author ever published in these pages.” As the prose washes over him, Alex's awe and longing for mingle together and bring tears to his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises, but it’s obscured by clouds threatening ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah slips out of Josh’s room and tiptoes down the stair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah walks in and pours herself a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Busted. Sarah jumps. Siri’s drinking coffee in her running gear o the front porch. She gets up and joins Sarah inside.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus. Do the others know too?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Paper-thin walls.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Perfect. Sarah pours them each a mug of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: No one’s judging.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Besides me! It’s like I’m this mature, successful, adult person now. Except when I’m with Josh and then it’s sophomore year, and I’m insecure, and--

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: It’s complicated. He was your first.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, it’s simple. He’s using me.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Who’s to say you aren’t using him?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Because he’s a man-child who uses sex as a means of processing serious emotional issues.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: And you’re an overworked tax attorney who could stand to get laid!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: M and A.  39.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: What? Sarah shoots Siri a look of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Mergers and Acquisitions. That’s the kind of law I do.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Right. Siri fiddles with the sugar jar. Sarah drops it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you still...?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m think I’m still a little pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Have you taken a test?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why not? Siri and Sarah are interrupted by THE SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS the stairs. Isaac enters and gives Sarah a bemused look.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t. Say. Anything. Isaac raises his hands defensively and grabs some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: You’re up early.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (holds up his Blackberry) Conference call with Singapore. If I can find some freaking service. And can you guys do me a favor and make an effort to be nice to Kate?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why are you looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Why do you think?  40.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I found a signal on the porch. But you need to lean over the railing and hold one foot off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m serious! Isaac's PHONE RINGS. He weighs his options. Walks outside take it. Sarah and Siri watch from the window. Outside, Isaac looks around. Leans over and lifts one foo Siri and Sarah duck down and LAUGH LIKE GIRLS MUCH YOUNGE Alex enters in running gear and the attention quickly shi

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You don’t run.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m thinking of taking it up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're still recovering.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can always stop.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’ve been trying to motivate myself all morning. Come with me? Alex smiles at Siri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Siri jog.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So how’s Brooklyn?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: It’s fine.  41. Alex runs out of gas. He bends over, catching his breath. Siri puts her hand on his back. SIRI (CONT’D) Hey. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Those photos you put up the other day look great. The way you and Ben went to all those thrift shops. Made the place seem so home-like. All you need now is a golden retriever. Siri snorts. Starts walking and Alex walks after her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I went to the thrift shops. Ben moped. And it doesn’t look like we'll be getting a dog.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don’t get it. What’s--

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Can I tell you something? I don’t know who else... I just always felt like we could talk to each other.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I got a job in LA. Dream kind of offer. But Ben. It’s like he’s resisting at every turn. We’ve been fighting about going, fighting about staying. We haven’t had sex in weeks and--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. Didn't need to hear that last part but--

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Sometimes I just think some space would be good for-- Alex halts in his tracks.  42.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Stop. Okay? Just stop. You and Ben are gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: But he’s not fine, Alex. That’s the point.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I mean... he’s blocked.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Blocked?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: You can’t tell him I told you this, okay? He’s barely written anything in almost a year. Alex tries digesting this. Can’t fully. Starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He’s the best writer I’ve ever read. I still remember the first time I read his stuff.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can quote paragraphs from that story. There’s no way he’s done writing. I won’t let him. Siri smiles. But she’s not quite sure anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Isaac sit together, eating toast.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I miss living down the hall from you. I could just pop over whenever I wanted to talk.  43.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Or sleep in my bed and cry about Josh. What was with those sleepovers, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t act naive...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're being serious right now?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: This is me being serious.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Isaac... (decides to go for it) I always wanted you to make a move.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: But you-- (dropping to a whisper) But you always said we shouldn’t because we were such good friends!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s what I said. Not what I wanted. Isaac’s thrown for a loop.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I just. I can’t... you’re impossible. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Fine. Your whole sex is impossible if that makes it less personal. Sarah dabs some cream cheese on Isaac’s nose. He grabs a stick of butter and SHE SCREAMS AS SHE AVOIDS HIM, LAUGHI Josh and Kate enter and are privy to the scene.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Wait. I can use that. Josh grabs a piece of toast and uses it to wipe Isaac’s n  44.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Thank you. Everyone’s amused except Kate.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 49 INT. ‘BEN AND SIRI’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 49 The FAINT SOUND OF LAUGHTER emanates from downstairs. Ben sits on the edge of the bed in his underwear, facing his laptop. He looks at the machine like it’s a menacing obje

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Alright. You and me. Who’s it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh nurses his coffee. Ben walks in, looking defeated. J Josh at the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: About time, you lazy bum.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You hook up with Sarah again? Ben raises his hand for a high five. Josh leaves him hang

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: How’s Siri?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She’s on a run.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Huh. They catch sight of Siri and Alex approaching the house.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: And... she’s back.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex tries the bathroom door. It’s locked.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: One second! The door opens and Kate appears.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All yours.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thanks. There’s an awkward moment where Alex fails to move.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. I’m sorry... about what I said last night.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. You’re not even 48 hours removed from a traumatic event. You're suddenly the subject of a lot of love and attention and it’s making you feel a bit manic but also oddly angry. I imagine you experience rapid mood cycling and you’re scared as hell about the next time you’1ll crash. So no, I’m not taking it personally. Alex is surprised by her insight and candor.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And don’t worry. You'll level off. Kate brushes by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh runs into Siri, who’s performing sun salutations. He lights a cigarette and gestures towards some flowers.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Early for these guys to be in bloom.  53 46.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Who are you? Ralph Waldo Emerson?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Just an avid student of climate change. Did you know they’re using Thoreau’s diaries to measure the effects? In 15 years you'll be able to plant mangos here. I’m just waiting for the right moment to buy up vast tracts of Canadian wilderness and then-- Josh trails off. Siri looks up at him from her downward d

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: What? Then what? Josh realizes he’s been staring and looks away.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - A LITTLE LATER Isaac KNOCKS ON THE DOOR and enters.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Knock, knock? Who’s there? He finds Kate, reading on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. I’m done with work. Want to take a walk? (Kate shrugs) Okay. What’s up? Kate keeps reading. Isaac lies down and puts his head dow her stomach, obstructing her line of sight. Kate sits up.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Every time I turn around you're laughing with her. Or you’re reminiscing with her. Or--

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You're being ridiculous.  47.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Belittle my feelings. That always helps. Kate gets up and goes for the door.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Kate. Come on! But she walks out. OFF Isaac, lying on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of feet dip gingerly into the stream. Alex, Ben, J and Isaac sit on rocks on the river bank.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You’ve got great southern exposure, so I was thinking of installing a solar array. Maybe a few rainwater basins too.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: And then you'd have everything you need to start your own cult. Wouldn’t that be something?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m in. Josh wields a fishing rod. Casts a line. He’s an inept fisherman.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You guys remember Michael?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I still see him sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Guess how much he made when facebook went public?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: 60 million dollars. Isaac whistles.  48.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much do you make?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Come on. I think we’re past politeness.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I know you are. (a beat) I’m still the kid who wouldn’t miss a meal in the dining hall, even on Friday nights.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do with it?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I'd invest, but I know too many bankers.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You can always give some to me.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Thanks, Josh. Alex tosses a small rock into the water. Isaac follows su

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think the girls are doing right now?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Their hair.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Each other.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: There’s a thought.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe we should propose an elaborate swap.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m sure they'd be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Numbers are uneven.  49.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No they’re not. Alex gets sweet, nubile Kate, Isaac gets Sarah, and I get Siri because, well, she’s all that’s left. Oh and Ben gets to be published in The New Yorker.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’s hilarious. There’s a silence, but it’s broken by a DOG’S BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: A dog, Sherlock. They all look around. Sure enough, a dog appears, looking disoriented. Alex kneels and checks for a collar.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: There aren’t that many houses around here. Where’d you come from?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hello! Anybody lose a dog? His yells are met by silence. The dog looks up expectantl

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He looks hungry. Ben takes out a granola bar. Isaac stops him.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Whoa. You don’t feed a strange dog.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Because you’1ll just confuse it and make everything worse.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit. Ben bends down and feeds the dog. Storm clouds gather.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I just felt a drop. It’s gonna start pouring.  55 56 50.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well we can’t just leave him here.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Owner should have thought of that and put a tag on him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah and that poor person should have made more money if he was planning on getting sick. Don’t tell me you’ve turned Republican on us too.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What if I did? Everyone’s stunned by Isaac’s heresy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRACK OF THUNDER. Sarah finds Siri reading on the couch

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The boys better be close or they’1l be drenched. Want to go on a food run?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m actually feeling a little sick... but I did want to pick something up. Siri hands over her keys. Sarah gives her a worried nod.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I’1l go. Sarah turns and see Kate, standing behind her in the door She smiles, trying to master her displeasure.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys plus dog walk, getting drenched by the rain. The shout in order to be heard above the storm.  They walk 51.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is it because you grew up poor?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Is it because your family was poor?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Kind of like, “I worked hard to feed and clothe myself. Why can’t other people? Why can’t the dog?”

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Some people do work harder than others.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No one is self-made.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: But there are degrees. in silence for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What about your roots? Wasn’t your dad in like an auto workers’ union?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me about my roots.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m just saying--

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No, you're not, Josh. This isn’t a fucking seminar and I’m tired of you making some sort of fetish out of my family. Okay? Josh shuts up. The guys trudge on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Kate peruse the produce aisle. Kate grabs a watermelon and holds it aloft.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Will this one work? Sarah takes it, holds it to her ear, and taps on it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not ripe enough. Sarah selects another. Repeats the process. Puts it in th cart and moves on brusquely. They reach a pyramid of appl

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: When did you first meet Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Freshman year. He lived across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: God I was so nervous about going on this trip. I guess I still am.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (still uninterested) Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Isaac just looks up to you guys so much. It’s like meeting the parents, but worse because there are five of you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Be happy you’re not meeting his parents. Sarah moves on to the onions. Kate tries a different tact

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m so jealous of you. Kate succeeds in getting her attention with that one.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You guys just have all these experiences of him I’1l never have.  53.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well. What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I just want to feel like I’ve known him for years.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Isaac was... shy, sweet. The only one of us from the Midwest. The least neurotic of the bunch by far.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I can see it. Sometimes I think he takes me fancy places to impress me. Which is really cute, but it’s not why I like him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why do you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Because he’s grounded. He’s kind. And he gets all worried when I’m sad. The other week we celebrated our quarter-year anniversary. Which is ridiculous but made me so happy. And he has the right priorities. Which I think is really rare. Sarah absorbs Kate’s description. Allows herself -- just a second -- to be overcome.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (recovering) Yeah. You're right. That’s exactly him! What else is on our list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drenched to the bone, the guys burst in. Siri is at the table, drinking a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Big news.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: What?  54.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Isaac's a Republican.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’s not the news. The dog bounds in and SHAKES HIMSELF DRY, soaking everyth

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We found a dog.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: What? Where?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. In the woods.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m going to take a shower. Everyone looks at one other. Ben moves to follow Alex.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Uh. Here. Lemme--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What? Bathe me?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No. Just--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm fucking fine, okay? (to everyone) Thanks for all the concern, but I’m fucking fine! And you can stop following me around, okay? Alex stomps upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You heard the man. He’s fucking fine! No one finds this particularly funny.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: He’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I... just know.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I‘1l invent an excuse to go up there in a minute. Sarah and Kate burst in the door, bearing loads of grocer

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sweet nectar and ambrosia!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There’s more in the car. Everyone gets up to help. Sarah hands Ben the car keys. T dog goes to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You know Josh. Makes friends wherever he goes... Isaac buttonholes Kate.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (apologetic) Hey. I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You too. Kate kisses him. Sarah clocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex rejoins the warmer and drier group. Ben and the dog stare at each other. Siri feeds Ben a slice of watermelon

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Your relationship with that dog is becoming unhealthy.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Shhh. I think I can read Timmy's thoughts.  56.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Timmy? Eye rolls all around. Ben starts doing the voice of the d

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Gee am I glad I’m inside and not lost in the woods. That mean one with the effeminate shoes almost didn’t let me. I’ll bite him later. Everyone laughs. Josh takes his turn.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I love young urban professionals. You always have the freshest, most organic food. And your liberal guilt makes you incapable of withholding it from me. More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just thought of something.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I told Siri I loved your place and all you were missing was a dog. And now you’ve got your chance. Ben looks to Siri. Sarah notices her becoming upset.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: We're not getting a dog.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why not? You guys even have that little back yard. Everyone looks to Siri. She looks to Ben for help but doe get any. She gets progressively more worked up as she struggles to answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: We just... It’s not... You know what? Ben can fucking tell you. Siri walks out. All the confused attention shifts to Ben.  60 57.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (in a bid to distract) So... what are we making?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Chilled watermelon soup and sea scallop risotto.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Fancy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I like a challenge. Sarah notices Josh rolling a joint on the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What? It’s like a magic appetizer that makes everything that follows taste that much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire crackles. Isaac makes a cocktail while Ben combs through a stack of LPs. Holds up Bruce Springsteen's Nebraska. Josh groans.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It’s like we're gripped by this never-ending nostalgia for our parents’ music. It’s oppressive.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on. Who today rivals The Boss?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, it’s unhealthy for any generation to agree so thoroughly with its parents that its own music sucks. Ben digs around. Holds up Arcade Fire’s Neon Bible instea JOSH (CONT’D) Arcade Fire?  61 58.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Too Canadian. But who knows... Josh lights his joint. Inhales deeply. Exhales. JOSH (CONT’D) Maybe it fits our post-modern profile for a Canadian band to best express American anxiety in its gradual post-empire period of decline. He offers the joint to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t normally--

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It wont bite. Kate accepts Josh’s gift. Inhales. Coughs. Offers it to S but she refuses. Ben notices. Odd.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus what is wrong with everybody? I mean. If now isn’t a time to get fucked up, I don’t know when is. Josh hands Ben the joint and selects a record. JOSH (CONT’D) Fuck it. Let’s dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As THE MUSIC BLASTS in the next room, Sarah begins to coo dicing ginger, adding water to the risotto, lightly brais the scallops. She really is an artist in the kitchen. Isaac appears. Looks on in awe. Sarah notices him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: How serious were you this morning?  62 63 59.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Come on. About us.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Isaac. I just thought... No, you know what? I’m sorry I said anything. I shouldn't of--

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Well I’m not. Sorry. They look at each other, both aware of the magnitude of w they're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Isaac! Get your anti-government ass in here! Isaac holds Sarah's gaze for another second. Then retreat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music still blares. People dance stupidly. Josh rolls another joint. Everyone helps themselves to more drugs an alcohol except for Siri, who again refuses. OFF Ben, studying her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben pulls Siri inside. The MUTED THROB OF MUSIC AND LAUGH can still be heard over in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Ben. What is it? What!?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Nothing.  60.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: When have you ever turned down a joint?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m not in the mood. Ben just looks at her. SIRI (CONT’D) Dammit Ben! Siri starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I didn’t want it to influence you. Us. It should be about us.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What should?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m... I don’t know. I... I think I might be pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Really? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: No. I just... I’m really late. And-- (she notices Ben’s face) What? What are you thinking? Why do you look like that? There’s a pause.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m imagining a baby. One who looks half like you and half like me.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: That tends to happen...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No. I’m serious.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I know. I’m sorry. I just--  64 65 61.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Maybe I can just go with you. I mean, sure, I’1l be unemployed. But people do it. Maybe I can just give up writing and find something that doesn’t make me feel crazy.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Ben. Don’t say that. Don’t say... any of this unless you mean--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Siri. Let’s try. Ben kisses her. Hard. Siri’s scared as hell but also happ in spite of herself. She kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet another joint is passed around. Kate is particularly gone -- swaying unsteadily, kissing Isaac’s neck and ear. Sarah enters. Finds everyone except Ben and Siri partying

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Food’s ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Everyone eats ravenously.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s the sound of hungry people eating.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The food's incredible. Everyone murmurs their agreement.  62.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You guys are just saying that because you’re stoned out of your minds.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: We're barely high. We notice Kate licking the remains of her watermelon soup

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Some of us might be... Kate looks up apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It just feels so nice and cool on my tongue.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Seriously. Why haven’t you opened your own restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s called law school loans.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why didn’t we do more drugs in college?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I figure I’d be much less curious now if I’d only done a better job getting it out of my system back then. As it stands, I’m stunted.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We were doing well for a while there during freshman year. Remember when Siri took her clothes off in the Silliman quad?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Shut up! You dared me! Everyone chimes in with their own favorite memories and embellishments.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What happened to us?  63.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: We got serious.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We got girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know what this is like?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is like The Big Chill, except Kevin Costner is alive.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Costner was in The Big Chill?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: His feet were, at least.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What are you guys talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Timmy’s favorite movie.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Who's Timmy?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Don’t listen to him.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Why does everything in our lives have to be like something else?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: That’s deep.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: No. I’m serious!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Because that’s how people relate to each other these days. We don’t talk about things. We reference them. Like, “How was your weekend?” “It was good. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kind of like Wedding Crashers meets The Beach." Or “I feel just like Rachel when she found out Ross was marrying that British girl.”

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Did you just admit to watching Friends?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You know what? That’s not the fucking point.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (touching her face) I’ve never felt this high in my life. Kate wipes her forehead and BEGINS UNBUTTONING HER SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is anyone else, like, really, really hot? Isaac comes to her aid.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s probably enough buttons.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You mean bud.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I mean both. A CELL PHONE RINGS. Everyone looks for the source.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ooh, that’s mine! Kate finds her phone and answers it at the table.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Uh huh. (a pause) Tonight? Of course I’m okay. (another one) Okay bye! Kate hangs up the phone. Clocks everyone’s expectant look Promptly BEGINS HYPERVENTILATING.  65.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m on the edge of my seat.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: They want me to cover on the crisis hotline. Tonight. I can’t breathe. I can’t breathe.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Sure you can. It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m sure she'll do great.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She'll knock ‘em dead.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: That isn’t funny.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s a little funny. Kate EMITS A PLAINTIVE WAIL and sinks onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I can’t do this right now. Isaac gets down on the floor. Fans her while cradling her head. Sarah gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’ve got some Xanax in my purse.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (reaching into his pocket) I’ve got some Klonopin right here.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
