dialogues.text: Xanax kicks in faster. Sarah leaves the room to get it. Josh CALLS AFTER HER.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Well Klonopin lasts longer!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Which one do you prefer, Timmy?  66 66. The dog looks at Ben. Isaac tries to calm Kate.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Hey. Look at me. We’ll get you all set up in a quiet room upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (as the dog) I experience less side effects with Xanax.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You can talk on the phone just like you're talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You’1l do fine. Sarah reenters and hands Isaac two pills.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And now you've got the best anti- anxiety medicine money can buy.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Well, that’s disputed. Isaac helps Kate swallow the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plates are cleared, surfaces sponged, pots scrubbed. Everyone’s there except Isaac and Kate. Ben holds up a ne clean bowl of soup.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey look. Kate missed a spot. The guys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What a nutter.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on. Remember the first time I got really high? It happens. Stop being assholes.  67.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Since when have you become her advocate?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m not. I’d just... hate to know what you say whenever I leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. We’ll tell you you're crazy to your face. Sarah swats Josh with a dish towel.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 67 INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 6 Isaac dotes on Kate as she gets ready for her shift.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Okay. You’ve got a glass of water. You've got emergency Xanax. You’ve got lumbar support. And you’ve got this bucket in case you feel like you need to puke.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: For how I just freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone except Kate, Ben, and Siri sits around, drinking more alcohol, the atmosphere slightly darker and drunker.  68.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Josh) Since when did you start taking meds?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Oh, you know. Now and then I score some from friends who are really fucked up. They’re like, “I’m so fucked up, I don’t know what to do with all these meds.” So I help them out.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: By purchasing their prescription drugs?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Medication is wasted on the sick. Besides, it’s only for when I’m wondering whether I’m wasting my life on a dissertation no one in their right mind will ever read. Sarah digs into her purse and produces a stack of index cards.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let’s play a game.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Do you keep things in your purse just in case the conversation gets too depressing?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (dealing the cards) It’s just blank index cards.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then what are the rules?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (passing out pens) You make them up as you go. (writing something down) Here. I’1l go first. Sarah lays a card down and Isaac reads it aloud.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Everyone must touch their head and rub their belly before playing a card -- or they have to drink.  69. Ben and Siri appear. Glowing a bit like we haven’t seen t

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Playing an imbecilic game.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m in. Ben grabs five blank cards and sits down next to Josh. Is writes on an index card and plays it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You didn’t pat your head and touch your belly.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Do we have to keep saying the word “belly”? It’s weirding me out. Isaac drinks. Josh picks up Isaac’s card and reads aloud.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Before you speak you must turn to the person on your left and introduce yourself, then hug. (to Isaac) You're fucking kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You didn’t introduce yourself before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You didn’t either. Sarah turns to Isaac and Josh turns to Ben. Awkwardness ensues.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH JOSH
dialogues.text: Hi, my name is Sarah. It’s Hi, I’m Josh. This game is great to meet you. slowly making me stupider. The two pairs hug gingerly. Josh scribbles furiously, pat his head and rubs his stomach, lays a card. Ben picks it and looks to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Ben. Ben and Alex hug. Ben reads warily from the card.  70.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suicide. Everyone must take turns explaining what it means to them. Everyone's silent. Sarah shoots Josh a look. Quickly writ something on a card. Pats her head, rubs her stomach, and lays it down. Isaac picks it up and turns to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Isaac and I’m a Republican. Play this card at any time to make all of Josh’s rules invalid.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) You can’t do that. You played out of turn.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The card said it could be played at any time.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: But that’s violating the game's underlying architecture of taking turns laying cards.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Let me just add. Neither of you introduced yourselves before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH JOSH
dialogues.text: Neither did you! Neither the fuck did you!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay, Josh. Let’s do it. But you start. Everyone's startled by Alex’s comment. It’s as if they’d forgotten he was there in the room.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Okay. I get sadness, I get depression, I get anxiety. I’m pretty sure I’m experiencing at least one of them at all times. But I don’t understand suicide because I’ve never once been not absolutely terrified of death.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t want to play this game anymore.  71.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Why not? We’ve been dancing around the main point of this trip all weekend. I mean, Christ! No one will even talk about the downstairs bathroom and why we’re not using it. So let’s open that door. Literally, metaphorically. Pardon the pun.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Josh. Stop!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: No. Alex should give it to us straight. Tell us how good a job we all did in bucking him up when he was down. How we noticed his increasingly erratic Tweets and status updates and thought enough to do something about it. How this group meant something more than our own entertainment back in college. How it still means something now. Sarah jumps up and leaves the room, MUFFLING A SOB. Alex hesitates and Isaac looks up. Ben’s become white as a she

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let her go. She’1l be okay.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I’m a truth teller.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Alex always wrote crazy shit on Twitter. How were we supposed to know that this time--

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What was it? Ask for me tomorrow, and you shall find me a grave man? Lot of ambiguity in that one.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Well then where the hell were you?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: That’s my fucking point! Where the hell were any of us?  72.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (softly) It was my fault. Everyone looks at Ben. Confused by what he’s just said.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alex called me that day. A few times. I didn’t pick up. (starts getting emotional) I didn’t pick up even though I knew he wasn’t doing well. I didn’t. I was avoiding it. It’s my fault... Fucking hell it’s my fault!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No it’s not. I mean, yeah. I was upset you weren’t answering. But I... I didn’t want to die.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What? Then why’d you--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I mean. I thought at one point I did. But then I changed my mind. I called the hospital myself. I think... I think I just really wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. You. Everyone. All of Ben’s pent-up guilt and vulnerability starts evolv into some serious anger.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me and this is what you did?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m not trying to say it makes sense. I just--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Do you know what I’ve been feeling since--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes. I do!  69 73.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: And now you’re saying it’s cause you fucking wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well it’s not like any of the more conventional options were working!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I had shit to do. I was living my life. I was busy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What was keeping you so busy that you couldn’t find the time? Clearly not your fucking book. Ben’s thrown by this. Looks to Siri in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You told him.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Ben...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you did that. Ben storms out onto the back porch. Siri’s not sure wheth to follow him. No one knows what to say to each other.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘SARAH'S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 69 Sarah lies curled up on her bed. Josh appears in the door

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Hey. She doesn’t respond. Josh lies down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Sometimes things need to get said. And in those instances being an asshole comes in handy. They lie in silence. Josh kisses Sarah’s shoulder, her ne

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Josh. Stop.  74. But Josh keeps kissing her until she pushes him away and out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Josh!

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What? All that talk about death? Tell me you don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know what I want? I want you to have acted like my boyfriend seven years ago. Taken me to a movie. Bought me a fucking ice cream cone. I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sarah. Come on. Josh sits on the edge of the bed. Sarah’s fighting a losi battle against her composure.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Instead of being the guy who permanently fucked up my expectations for normalcy in a relationship. The guy who made me explain to my mom that no, Josh isn't exactly my boyfriend. He’s more like someone who sleeps with me when he comes home pining for my best friend and too drunk to see straight. Josh gets up and walks towards her as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I was 20.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So was I.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: My dad was leaving my mom.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Is that your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I was just so... angry. At him. At Ben. At everyone.  70 71 75.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That you didn’t even see what you were doing to me? Josh is inches away from her, at once hurt and seeking forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please leave. Josh stumbles to his feet. Leaves. Sarah’s feeling a mill emotions at once. But she’s also proud of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben holds a beer and looks up at the stars. Swaying sligh he’s noticeably drunk. The dog approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Timmy. Do you like it outside? Does it remind of your ancient past? When you were a fearsome wolf? He kneels down. Grabs the dog and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was a wolf too, you know. Don’t believe me? I was published at nineteen, Timmy. Nineteen. But then. Then I started thinking. Ben gets up and starts pacing around. Looks at the dog.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh come off it. My prose is not “Byzantine.” But seriously. In all honesty. It’s nice to have someone to talk to about all this. Cheers. Ben downs his drink. Tosses it off the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siri enters. Pulls down her pants and sits on the toilet. Notices something we can’t see. She’s suddenly filled wit overwhelming mixture of relief and loss.  72 73 76. Someone outside tries to turn the door knob and finds it locked. Siri struggles to compose herself and sound norma

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: One minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex moves away from the bathroom door. He heads back downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex stops at the bottom of the landing when HE HEARS KAT VOICE emanating from the other room, the door ajar. He in closer and spies on her: Kate lies with her feet on the w and her head dangling off the bed. Sleepy and stoned, she talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Amber. That’s a pretty name. How old are you? (a pause) What’s up? What’s going on? (another one) Man. That’s tough. It’s so tough to feel like you've finally found that person. Like they’re so right for you. And they don’t feel the same. Alex continues to listen in. At first, he’s bemused. But, slowly, Kate’s words begin to get to him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Like, they’re not perfect. In fact, they’re flawed. And fucked up. But you even love their fuck-ups. And you're like, why can’t you see what I see? Kate listens with her eyes closed, then she opens them. KATE (CONT’D) But Amber. Amber. Lemme tell you something. A lot of people, they’re afraid to feel what you’re feeling. They don’t let themselves. (a pause) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 77. KATE (CONT’D) But you. You’re willing to go there. And, yeah, break down a bit when it doesn’t pan out. And to me, that means you are very, very brave. And to me, that means you’11l be just fine. Alex stands in the same position, except now he’s crying. advice is so juvenile and so simple, but it gets him. It’s like she was talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siri walks outside and finds Ben. She stands next to him the railing, but their gazes are far away.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Pitch me again.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: On what?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: On why you want to try.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Siri. I told you. I want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: But tell me more. I need reasons.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Because... Because it turns out I’m not, okay? Turns out it was a false alarm. Ben takes this in. It hurts.  78. SIRI (CONT’D) And I think you got caught up in the moment and you said some things but you don’t really feel that way. And you're going to regret it. Ben’s silent. SIRI (CONT’D) What? Say something!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Siri. I wasn’t lying back there. But... maybe you’re right. Maybe... I don’t know. Siri feels this like a punch to the gut.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I push you that much and you fold. You're not even fighting me! I can’t believe you. I don’t know why I keep expecting--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’s not fair. You always pretend to be the one who’s all in. But I don’t think you want this. You just don’t want to be the person who admits it. Siri’s floored. And frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I have tried and tried to tell you that I don’t care what you do--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: “Try” being the operative word, Siri. I can feel you trying.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Goddamn I wish you could hear yourself sometimes!

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Because I love you!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: But I can’t handle your self- loathing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. But I don’t want to like myself right now. Siri fixes Ben with her gaze. Turns and walks back into t house. Ben KICKS A WATERING CAN across the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah finds a joint. Looks around before lighting it and inhaling. Isaac enters and she quickly stashes it.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Some night.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I wasn’t joking about dinner, by the way. You have a real gift.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m serious. You should open up your own restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m sure that would fly with my parents. They work their whole lives so I can become a doctor... I think they may have finally made peace with my law degree.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with owning a restaurant?  80.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nothing! It’s just... It would break their hearts.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: So you'll just give up on what you want?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who says it’s what I want? Isaac looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. It’s what I want. Without warning, Isaac MOVES IN TO KISS HER, but she danc out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Fuck. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t take it personally. It’s... a new policy of mine.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I just did the same thing to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: So what you’re saying is I’m the second reject of the evening.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Isaac. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I just. I really thought this was what you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I did! I do. I mean... for a long time, I did.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But you don’t want this. Your shy, nineteen-year-old self does. You want closure. You want to express your anxieties about how this thing with Kate might be real. Because I think it is real, and I think you think it could be real. (a beat) You want all those things, but not me. Not really, at least. That’s why. Isaac processes this. As if on cue, THEY HEAR FOOTSTEPS a turn to see Kate entering from the dining room. Isaac attempts to shift gears quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Hey! Is your shift over?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And I don’t even think I have blood on my hands.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (trying her best) That’s great! Isaac feels horribly guilty. Kisses Kate on her forehead. Meets eyes with Sarah as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Ready for bed?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Isaac and Kate exit. Once they’re out of sight, Sarah exhales. That was really hard for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh appears. Joins Ben and lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Where’ve you been?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Attempting to have sex with Sarah.  82.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Good for her for turning you down.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Thanks. They stand for a moment in silence.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I can’t remember which happened last: Me writing something good. Or Siri and I having sex.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: So what you’re saying is you’re blocked in more ways than one.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s just a phase. I hear women go through those.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Not a phase. A symptom. Of something bigger. Ben motions for a cigarette. Josh obliges him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to hold her too tightly and I’m afraid to give her too much space. Fuck. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Wow. Your life sounds as fucked up as mine.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Let’s not get ahead of ourselves. Ben can’t help but smile. Josh does the same. They both S CHUCKLING at the sad irony of their circumstances. Then there’s a pause as Josh summons up the will to say w comes next.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: And to think I’ve been jealous of you for seven years. Josh's honesty is cathartic.  80 83. JOSH (CONT’D) You know, as much as I’d love to derive some perverse pleasure in all this, I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Josh puts a hand on Ben’s shoulder. It’s a reconciliation sorts.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALEX’S ROOM, THE CABIN - A LITTLE LATER 80 Alex is in bed reading. There’s A SOFT KNOCK at the door Siri appears, looking distraught and ghostly and beautifu

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey. What’s up? Siri walks closer and sits on the edge of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For what? We realize that Siri’s crying.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I... don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You've been quiet this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Everybody likes talking more than listening. Sometimes I get tired of it and prefer the opposite.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If that’s not a rare quality, I don’t know what is. Siri pauses and looks down at Alex’s bandaged wrists.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Can I see them?

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. Slowly, Siri UNWRAPS ALEX'S BANDAGED WRISTS. When they’re bare, she grabs hold of his hands and lowers her head to at his wounds up close. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Siri holds Alex's gaze another moment, then she begins to kiss his wrists, moving slowly up his arms.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Siri. I--

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I’m as close to him as you’re ever going to get. They begin to kiss feverishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Josh amble inside and find Sarah, sitting with th dog on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Looks like someone made a friend.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He’s sure nicer than you all.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Where'd everybody go?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Isaac and Kate went to bed. I think Siri did too...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What about Alex?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I thought he was with you!  82 83 84 85. The three quickly mobilize into high alert. They each tak off in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALEX’S STAIRCASE, THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 82 Ben takes the stairs with purpose, turning when he gets t the top.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALEX’S UPSTAIRS HALLWAY, THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 83 Ben walks quickly toward Alex's room. He flings open the and STOPS DEAD IN HIS TRACKS. There’s AN EXCRUCIATING MOMENT OF SILENCE, then all at on Ben turns around and rapidly retraces his steps.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Ben! But Ben doesn’t turn back or slow down. Moments later Ale and Siri appear, in close pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ben! Hold up. Alex makes it to the stairs first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben brushes past a bewildered Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ben. What is it? Seconds later, Alex and Siri do the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alex. What’s going on? No one answers her. Sarah and the dog follow them all out front door and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moonlit driveway. Ben brushes by a confused Josh. Alex the first to catch up with him. He grabs his shoulder and spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What can you possibly say to me right now? The others begin to gather a short distance away. Alex tr to put his arms around Ben.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That I... I love you. More than anyone in this world. Ben flings Alex's arms away and keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Fuck you. He goes to open the driver’s side door of Isaac’s rental Alex tries to grab him again.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Come on, Ben. You don’t even know how to drive. Ben TURNS AND SLUGS ALEX in a single motion, sending him reeling.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Can’t be that fucking hard. He hops in the car, finds the keys in the ignition, and starts the engine, cruising unsteadily down the driveway. THERE’S PANDEMONIUM as Alex and Isaac chase after the car while Siri runs to her Saab and tries to open the door. Siri searches frantically for her keys but can’t find the Out of breath, Alex and Isaac rejoin the others and look Siri, who’s emerged from her car.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where are your keys?  86 87 88 87.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (suddenly remembering) I gave them to Ben... Everyone looks to one another, unsure what to do now and helpless to change the situation.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: I/E. ISAAC’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 86 Ben drives poorly. Cursing, drunk, he fumbles around the steering column, trying to find the headlights, ACTIVATIN THE WINDSHIELD WIPERS instead. Finally, he switches on th lights. They illuminate a large tree in his path. Ben slams on the breaks. But it’s too late. The car skids into the tree. For a moment, EVERYTHING IS QUIET. Ben’s dazed and bleedi slightly from his forehead. He tries moving. It slowly da on him that he isn’t very hurt. Ben stumbles outside and performs a cursory inspection of car. Suddenly realizes he’s very cold. Ben climbs back into the car and sprawls out across the backseat. Looks over and notices A PEN AND PAD OF LEGAL P in the seat pocket. Grabs it and hurls it across the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex approaches the door to the downstairs bathroom. Open and takes in the messy scene without flinching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siri tentatively opens the door. Crawls into bed with Sar Sarah turns and puts her arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 89 90 92 91 95 88. INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - NIGHT 89 Kate sleeps. Isaac lies awake, watching her with a mixtur guilt and tenderness.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALEX’S ROOM, THE CABIN - NIGHT 90 Josh enters with a package of frozen peas, looking for Al Finds Ben’s article instead. He starts reading it. Smiles PRE-LAP: The sound of VIGOROUS SCRUBBING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hands with bandaged wrists move rhythmically across t tiles. Alex is on his knees, removing blood stains from t grout. He works feverishly, but he doesn’t seem desperate Instead he’s simply resolved to accomplish the task at ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just beginning to cast a faint glow in the eas hand scribbles notes furiously on a yellow legal pad. Ben doing something he hasn’t done in a long time. He’s writi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate emerges, feeling hung over. She notices Alex sitting the stairs, a package of frozen peas against his eye.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey. Alex notices her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey. How was your shift? Kate sits down next to him.  96 89.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Nobody killed themselves.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not that you believe I had a hand in that. Alex thinks a second, then looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Actually, that reminds me of something I wanted to talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Kate sits down besides Alex on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh enters with the dog on a MAKESHIFT LEASH and finds I and Siri. Isaac looks at him funny.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What? Sarah appears. She and Isaac both reach for the coffee machine at the some moment, then retreat. It’s awkward.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will someone please tell me what the hell is going on? Alex and Kate walk in. Alex avoids eye contact with Siri he pours himself coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Guys, I have an announcement. I’m sorry for fucking up all your lives.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Mine was already fucked. So don’t mention it.  98 90.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This isn’t a joke. I’m the cause of... all of this.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. So please just let me take some responsibility. Alex heads for the door. Sarah makes a move to go after h

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Alone. Alex leaves. They all hear the front door OPEN AND CLOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex keeps walking. Takes in the bird song. Calms his bre Finally, he catches sight of what he’s been looking for: Ben sits in the opened trunk of Isaac’s car. He’s writing the same legal pad and seemingly oblivious to everything else. As Alex gets close, Ben finally notices him and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nice shiner.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Nice driving. (a beat) What you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Just writing. Alex allows himself to smile, but it quickly vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ben. I’m a little fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Really?  99 Alex gl.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Can I play that card right now?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For how long, do you think?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t push your luck. starts to break down.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m just so--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey. World’s got enough people you gotta explain yourself to. Alex smiles at hearing his words repeated back to him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that one?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Some wise idiot said it to me once. Alex might want to say more, but instead he just nods. Be hugs him, taking him by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac joins Sarah. She leans on the balcony, smoking a jo

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Thanks, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: For rebuffing me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey. What are friends for?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’ve been thinking a lot this morning about investing.  92.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s not weird or anything.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m being serious. I want to invest in you. Sarah turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I want you to start that restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I thought we went over this last night.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: We did. But I haven’t changed my mind.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: On the contrary, I’m an exceptionally savvy businessman.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well I’m sorry but--

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m imagining a place, maybe on the Lower East Side. Sarah pretends not to be interested. ISAAC (CONT’D) Not too big. Twelve tables, at most. Food from... Begrudgingly, Sarah begins to play along.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Upstate.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Naturally.  93.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (half in jest) The dishes could make tasteful nods to the area’s fading Jewish and Chinese denizens.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Egg Drop Matzo Ball Soup?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Szechuan Brisket.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Stir-fried Kugel.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Gefilte Fish Dumplings?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Now we’re in business. Sarah laughs. She’s still skeptical and half-joking. Thou she can’t help but begin to imagine it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 100 INT. ‘BEN AND SIRI’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 10 Siri calls Ben for the millionth time. Gets his message, the phone down in despair. Josh appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: He’s just blowing off some steam.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Sure. (suddenly desperate) Josh. I really fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: He’1ll get past it. Siri doesn’t buy it. JOSH (CONT’D) It’s ironic, though.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I guess I always thought, if you were going to slip up, that it’d be with me.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Oh Josh. I could never have done that to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Sometimes your logic confuses me.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Me too. They hear A CAR APPROACHING. Siri goes to the window. 101 Siri watches Isaac’s rental car roll slowly up the drivew The dog rushes out in front of the cabin, barking. Siri’s suddenly flustered. An emotion she almost never displays. She tries to fix her hair in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You’ve never not looked beautiful. Siri stops fussing and looks up at Josh. She’s still anxi but she smiles thankfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex drives and Ben rides shotgun. Alex parks the car.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: So you'll consider the offer? Ben nods. Alex looks at the legal pad in Ben’s hands. It’ filled with writing.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s really fucking good, you know. Quite an auspicious start.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I have you to thank for that also.  95. Alex nods. A wry expression on his face. They both smile sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Alex get out of the car to find the dog, all whip up in a frenzy. Ben gets down to pet it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey Timmy. Missed you. Ben looks up to see Isaac, Josh, and Siri waiting.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (re: the car) Gee thanks, you guys. Really glad I declined the insurance.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You can say it was an enormous elk.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: In the shape of a tree?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It jumped out at me like an elk. But the mood loses its levity when Ben and Siri lock eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Siri walk, for a long while in silence.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Do you hate me?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I could never do that.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Are you sure? They reach the spot at the end of the field and look back towards the house. Ben turns to face her.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be fair to forgive Alex and not you.  96.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Guys do it all the time. They look out at the Hudson Valley. Ben picks up a stone throws it Ben looks as far as he can. They both watch it fall.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe my luck freshman year when I found out you’d been placed across the hall. When we actually spoke I was tempted to throw away the idea of dumb luck and start invoking God and Fate and other capitalized words.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Ben. Why are you talking about this?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Because if entropy is this force that’s always conspiring to pull people apart, staying together has its own inertia too. at her.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m really scared of what the world will look like without you.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: You can’t stay with me because you're afraid.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You're right. Siri fixes him with her fierce gaze, but it slowly soften into sadness. She rests her head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘ISAAC AND KATE’S ROOM,’ THE CABIN - CONTINUOUS 106 Kate and Isaac pack with their bags on opposite beds. Isa distracted, alternating between checking emails on his Blackberry and packing his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Well how was that for an introduction to my friends?  97.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: A bigger disaster than I could have possibly imagined.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You're telling me.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And now you're going to dump me as soon as we’re not trapped together at thirty thousand feet. Isaac puts down his phone and turns around. Kate turns al

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what? You just said it. I made a total fool of myself.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa. My friends were the disaster. Isaac goes to Kate and holds both her arms.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As for you, I'd prefer if you never left my line of sight.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I was going to say never left my arms, but I thought I’d compromise.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Never open a negotiation with a concession.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Good point. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh, Sarah, Alex, and the dog all lounge on the couches.  98.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So we’re all doomed, romantically speaking. Aren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Only on like a deep, karmic level.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: For some reason I feel strangely okay about that. Sarah and Alex both look at Josh like he’s gone mad.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Maybe I’m turning over a new leaf!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Maybe we should make one of those pacts to just get married if we’re still single and thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Who? The three of us?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We'd be the most dysfunctional family ever.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: I'd consider it. They hear the SOUND OF ROLLING SUITCASES and turn to see Isaac and Kate enter from the mud room.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Going so soon?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: We've got a flight to catch out of Newark.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Lemme see if I can rustle up Ben and Siri... As Josh exits, Isaac hugs Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: So see you real soon, I hear?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hopefully by the end of the month.  108 99.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Alex looks to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Alex asked if there were any openings at the place I work. I told him there’s a strong likelihood I could get him a job. OFF Alex, feeling more at peace with himself than he has long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac, Kate, and Sarah stand off to the side as Siri, Jos Ben, and Alex help load Siri’s car.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m going to miss you guys.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Me too. But I plan on making frequent trips to check up on my investment. Sarah gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t think for a second I was joking. Josh looks up from packing.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: What investment?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m going to stake Sarah in opening a restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He’s lost it.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m serious.  100.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Jesus, Sarah. Take the money before he gets an even worse idea about what to do with it. Sarah smiles. Josh looks at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Where’s your stuff?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, about that. Everyone looks at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was thinking I might stay on for a little while and write. The attention shifts to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Seems like Ben got a good idea for a story last night. I said he should stay here and write it down.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Wait. Staying was an option? Everyone smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m serious! Anyone else got any secrets they want to share?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I do. We need a group photo.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Jesus. I thought we talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I have time for exactly one photo. If we make it fast. The others all look at each other, a little uncomfortable the prospect. As they do so, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of excited noise and bustling. Ben, Siri, Josh, Sara Isaac, and Alex are all there, but their hair is differen and they look younger. Alex stands alone, holding a tray of food and scanning th sea of tables uncertainly. Ben approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey. Alex, right?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wanna join us?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Cool. Thanks. Alex and Ben navigate the dining hall and sit down at a t with Josh and Siri.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Yo. Don Quixote. I send you on a mission for ketchup. You come back with a lost boy. What the fuck. But Ben has noticed Siri.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hi. I don’t think we’ve met.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Siri, Ben. Ben, Siri. Ben holds Siri’s gaze as they shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: I think we’re in the same dorm. Sarah and Isaac sit down and break his trance. Isaac’s tr is laden with food.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Jesus. You know the food will still be here when we come back for breakfast, right?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Shut up, Josh.  110 102.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Sarah, I got this. Shut up, Josh. Everyone laughs. Josh pretends to punch Isaac. Isaac stea glance at Sarah, who’s caught looking at Josh. Josh and B only have eyes for Siri. Alex smiles. These people are going to be his friends.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Here. Let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate takes Sarah’s iphone. The six college friends form a tentative bunch in front of the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m gonna need you all to get a lot closer together. There’s a moment’s hesitation. Ben ends it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Come on. Ben spreads his arms and squeezes everyone in tight.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I have a proposal.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Next time we see each other, let’s shoot for a happier occasion.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is there going to be a next time?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Alex! Don’t even. Everyone looks at one another. It’s unclear who’s joking, who’s deluding themselves, and who’s not. It’s unclear if there will be another gathering like this or not.  103.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Okay everyone, on three: One... two... SMASH TO BLACK.
